channel.title: Sats
channel.description: [u][b][size=20pt]only read if u live in the uk or if u know about sats[/size][/b][/u] sats are the tests that u do at the end of year 6 and the end of year 9, if someone could pls find me the sats papers that were done in 2006 for year 9 i will be very greatfull and i will happily pay back the favour just ask me and i see if i know

item.title: Sats
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“kaza, post:4, topic:67115”][quote author=eekz link=topic=97997.msg1006044#msg1006044 date=1173750891]
well i didnt get my year 6 paper back and im sitting my year 9 one in about 2 monthes and i dont you get ure paper back with any major test

[/quote]

I’m takin’ my year 9 sats and i’m in year 8 because i pwn :D…[/quote]

Some clever year 8s in our school were given that option. In the mock tests they all got really low marks. I giggled! I got a level 7 on all my mocks so im not worrying.

item.title: Sats
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Hex Key, post:12, topic:67115”]I purposfully got a low mark in my english SAT so i would not go into top set english. I lpanned it so i would go into Second set, the second set teacher was the most generous marker ever. I ended up AVERAGING 25/25 for my literature courseworks and 24.5/25 fro language.

Being in top set is not always the best thing for your education.[/quote]

People think they will do well in school if they make it into the top sets. But if you can’t learn at the same pace as the other students then it really doesn’t help you at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Sats
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Mopman:

American SATs actually mean something.

Perhaps…the mean something to the extent that a decent score gets you into colleges, but they prove nothing about your intelligence or general knowledge and they are considered very little of a judge of overall high school performance. It has been said that the only thing American SATs test is your ability to take the SATs.

We also have similar standardized tests in the States to the British SATs as well…basically used to judge the overall achievement rating of kids in school and to determine the performance of the school as a whole (at least thats what we have in PA).

Read full topic

item.title: Sats
item.dc:creator: @Hex_Key Hex Key
item.description:
@Hex_Key wrote:

I purposfully got a low mark in my english SAT so i would not go into top set english. I lpanned it so i would go into Second set, the second set teacher was the most generous marker ever. I ended up AVERAGING 25/25 for my literature courseworks and 24.5/25 fro language.

Being in top set is not always the best thing for your education.

Read full topic

item.title: Sats
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

American SATs actually mean something.

British SATs aren’t called SATS anymore, they are National Curriculum Evaluations or something - they mean nothing to the student, they are evaluations of the school and curriculum used to develop it from year to year and rate the school on the performance tables.

However, in an attempt to get you to actually try your best, most schools use the SAT results to place you in classes for the next couple of years, which might affect which GCSE you sit (Higher/Intermediate/Foundation) - which IS fairly important.

Read full topic

item.title: Sats
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

If you take them twice during secondary school, I don’t think its the same test…ours in the US are drawn up by the ETS and provided by CollegeBoard (collegeboard.com)…I’m just curious whether are are or aren’t the same then?

Read full topic
